trans-unit.source: Provides a type-safe way to set the <xref href="System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByParams"></xref> property.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpCachePolicy.VaryByParams%2A> property identifies which HTTP `Get` or `Post` parameters ASP.NET uses to uniquely identify a variation of the response when there are multiple cached responses for a resource.
This is useful when a response depends on a set of client inputs, such as headers or parameters.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByParams> is not directly related to HTTP cache-control headers, but helps ensure that a client or proxy varies by the specified parameters.

For more information about `VaryByParams`, see RFC 2616: Hypertext Transfer Protocol -- HTTP/1.1, available on the [World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Web](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37125) site.
See section 14, "Header Field Definitions", for complete details.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByParams"></xref> class.
Gets an array of values which specify the HTTP `GET` or `POST` parameters to be used for varying the cache.
An array of values which contain the HTTP `GET` or `POST` parameters for varying the cache.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether an HTTP response varies by `Get` or `Post` parameters.

Setting the <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByParams.IgnoreParams%2A> property to `true` is equivalent to setting the [@ OutputCache](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28a9e101-fb44-4198-9cb6-b8a52312fec2) directive `VaryByParams` attribute to "none" for the resource.
`true` if HTTP request parameters are ignored; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cache varies according to the specified HTTP request parameter.

When used as an accessor (getter), the <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByParams.Item%2A> indexer returns `true` if a value for the specified parameter is found in the current parameters collection, or if the collection is set to vary by * (an asterisk), which indicates all parameters.

When used as a mutator (setter), the <xref:System.Web.HttpCacheVaryByParams.Item%2A> indexer sets the value for the parameter in the parameters collection that corresponds to the specified header to `true`.
The value * can be specified, which indicates all parameters.
The name of the custom parameter.
`true` if the cache should vary by the specified parameter value.
is `null`.
Sets an array of values which specify the HTTP `GET` or `POST` parameters to be used for varying the cache.
An array of values which contain the HTTP `GET` or `POST` parameters for varying the cache.
